website_summaries.verdict: This unit comes folded and in great packaging, plus it's very portable.
pros: The foam is high quality as it is made without PBDEs, TDCPP or TCEP ("Tris") flame retardants, mercury, lead, heavy metals, formaldehyde or phthalate
It's waterproof and it has a non-skid bottom
cons: The material it's made of is very cheap

website_summaries.verdict: All the support and many of the features found in pricier models for a fraction of the cost.
pros: CertiPUR-US foam inner is made without harsh chemicals for a healthier sleeping surface and reduced off-gassing
CPSC approved dimensions fit standard cribs perfectly
Easy-care waterproof cover protects against spit up and leaks
Earns high praise for its ability to improve sleep quality
cons: Cover can't be removed for washing, but wipes clean easily enough

customer_reviews.title: Helps with reflux
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has reflux and hates sleeping flat. This helps her sleep so much better. She now sleeps 6+hrs a night. The only issue we ran into was that she slid down the wedge. We bought a swaddle best called Reste that attaches to the mattress so it keeps her on the wedge. Worth buying these items together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Place under the mattress. Not in the crib.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this for how the manufacturer says to use it. I purchased this for my daughter who had rsv and needed to sleep with her head elevated. After trying to install it, I see what other reviewers describe when they say it's not safe. I did not feel comfortable allowing my 5 month old to lay on this, so we improvised and placed the wedge under the mattress. This option is much safer and is still accomplishing the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies with reflux/transitioning from rock-n-plays
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to help transition my twins (who both have reflux!) from their rock-n-plays to cribs. My only complaint, which I've seen mentioned in other reviews, is that the bottom of the wedge seems like it would be uncomfortable to sleep on as baby wiggles down throughout the night (which mine seem to do a lot) and their head ends up on this part of the wedge by morning. Regardless, using this along with the Baby Merlin Magic Sleep Suits has been nothing short of amazing for the crib transition and my twins are sleeping 10-12 hours at night without waking up once. The gift of uninterrupted sleep for babies and parents is priceless!
customer_reviews.author: Mom To Twins

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective solution...lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase we made for our second born. My oldest slept in the crib from day one and we never had issues, so when number 2 came and refused to sleep anywhere but in the bassinet by Mommy I wanted to pull my hair out. We tried everything and finally concluded it was the need to be angled when he slept. I fou d this product and the first night we had it I place my son slept 12 hours in the crib. It was glorious!!! So grateful for such a simple yet effective solution that worked for us. Every child is different, but for us this was a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Finally EVERYBODY is getting a much needed good nights sleep!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! My little one has AR and this has made a HUGE difference in his sleep pattern! He sleeps longer and doesn't wake spitting up or coughing anything like he used to! I have him in our bedroom in a playpen with the elevated portion that we use as his crib next to our bed. This fits snugly in the playpen thank goodness! And it folds in half for easy travel when we visit family. I highly recommend this for any parent with a AR Baby!
customer_reviews.author: Notchomomma

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This did not come as one long unit but rather folded in half. You do have to unfold this and zip it together to get the full length but there's no dip in the middle. I placed this under the mattress and it elevates the head just enough to give my daughter comfort while she has a cold. Previous wedges I've used have angled the mattress too much and caused her to roll down to the foot of her bed, I have not had that issue with this one. Works great, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. NicholsTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: What a relief!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 month old grandson has acid reflux. My daughter has to hold him upright for hours on end and they were both misserable. I used this product along with a Reste infant back position sling and both are happy now! He has returned to his crib and she gets the piece of mind and rest she so desperately needed. Thank you! I would never use this lift without the sling...it keeps the baby in place. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Maruna

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My son had the start of a head cold. He was congested and not sleeping well. I noticed he slept better upright in my arms then in his crib. When he lay flat in his crib he would have trouble breathing through his nose and constantly woke up. After installing the wedge, he sleeps soundly and we are both breathing easy. The grip side holds the wedge in place. The other side is the same as his crib mattress. Great product and I definitely recommend it to for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Forfa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for babies who need to be on an incline
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter who was diagnosed with silent reflux. I was hesitant to use it since my daughter is a tummy sleeper (gasp!!! I know back is best. Trust me, I fought her on it for almost 2 months before I knew neither of us would ever sleep unless I just let her be comfortable). It arrived and I was so pleased at the quality of it. My daughter actually ended up doing so well on the meds she was prescribed so I ended up not needing to elevate her bed so I did return it. But I did consider keeping it since it was so affordable in case she needed it later on.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Alberes

customer_reviews.title: Tiny & not safe in a crib
customer_reviews.text: It's not wide enough for a mattress anyway as the baby would fall off if they rolled over, but more importantly, our doctor said under no circumstance should you put anything like this, or anything but a tight fitted sheet really, in a crib. She recommended something under the mattress to actually tilt the whole mattress as a solution over putting something in their crib.
customer_reviews.author: ummyeaaaa

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: EDIT*** another complaint is that my baby gets sooooo sweaty using this wedge. She didn't prior to using this. I have mixed feelings on this product. It does what it says its supposed to do. It has your baby sleeping on the slightest incline. It has helped out preemie with gas at night. My complaint is that my little one slides down the second she turns her head. Even the slightest movement causes her to slip down and before you know it it's just head that's at the smallest/thinnest part of the wedge. I do also wish the wedge itself was larger. It is wide enough to fit a standard crib however I just wish it was longer length wise.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: easily washable and fits in the crib well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to transition my baby from her rock n play to her crib. This worked wonders. She also has a bit of reflux and I think this helps her at night. The wedge is not very high (only 12 degrees) but enough to do the trick. The wedge is soft, easily washable and fits in the crib well. We also took this on a recent trip to use in a pack n play for sleeping and it was easy to pack and worked well on vacation too.
customer_reviews.author: SHSTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Ever ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Our son sleeps all night in his crib using the wedge. He went from a fisher price rock and sleep to his crib. We wanted something with enough lift that would make the transition smooth. The wedge was perfect. First night he slept 8 hours straight and there has been no turning back.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE 😡
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in this product as it claims to be safe. However upon using it one night I had breathing issues while laying beside it, so I decided to look up what it’s made of. 100% Polyurethane which can cause a host of health issues, and one of those is respiratory issues! How can you call this item safe when it’s made of this material? Now I’m very hesitant with buying any of your products knowing this.
customer_reviews.author: Missu2much

customer_reviews.title: Helps reflux infants
customer_reviews.text: Fits standard crib well. My son has really bad acid reflux and would cough, make choking noises and spit up when laying flat on his back, this fixed the problem and allowed him to sleep peacefully. However, it does not fit inside a pack n play and when folded in half has a much too extreme angle. I wish the sides could be zipped completely in half, then it would be absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hayfab

customer_reviews.title: Caved in within THREE DAYS
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product for 3 days now and the middle of the wedge has already caved in. In order for me to get a good incline on my son’s mattress, I had to unzip and fold the wedge in half. This product did not serve its purpose as it was intended.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Angled just enough!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. I am a new mom and was nervous about the transition into the crib, especially since it’s so flat. I got the crib wedge to make the transition more comfortable. It’s lightweight and soft but just the right amount of firmness as I was also nervous about flat head. I think this product is addressing all my concerns and he did so well in his crib so far! I will say when he moves throughout the night he slides down the wedge and ends up in the middle of the bed but he’s asleep by then so it doesn’t seem to bother him.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Helped with mild reflux
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 week old who I believe has mild acid reflux. I lay her down on this when she naps during the day, and the first day I used it she slept 30 mins longer. At night I noticed that her grunting or hiccuping had lessened, and that she was sleeping more peacefully. I would recommend this to anyone whose child has minor reflux issues, or who likes to sleep at a slight incline.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Have a fussy baby when you put them down to sleep?  This may just help
customer_reviews.text: I purchased based on the reviews and the fact that it was listed as a "Amazon choice" product. I bought this for my baby because she had some reflux and her pediatrician recommended that she be kept in an upright position. Since then we have kept it in her crib and she sleeps comfortably with it. Great product and value. And when not in use it can store easily and conveniently in the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies and kids with acid reflux!!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally love how this fits a play yard, a crib, and a toddler bed. this helps immensely with my child's acid reflux issues. easy to clean, easy to use and install. very safe compared to other methods. I like how my kid doesn't move much on it either- like it's perfectly made for back sleeping and not so bad that he falls to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: MB48

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Helps my daughter and me from stressing over her vomiting while sleeping and possibly aspirate after feedings at night so HUGE gain and nicer sleep for parents its easy to clean & again helps very well with her & her acid reflux issues keeping her head elevated all through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Payne

customer_reviews.title: Crib use of Wedge Pillow
customer_reviews.text: The product is performing as expected. It was purchased for our 4 month old grandson to relieve the acid reflux he occasionally experiences. It fit into the crib without problem and will be easy to clean. I would order it again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Faithfullyk

customer_reviews.title: Great for congestion or spit up
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my daughter was sick and wanted her elevated to help her congestion. This also helped her spit up she doesn’t always burp after her night feedings because she falls asleep after eating so it’s definitely helped bring that down to little to none.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Definitely helps our baby sleep
customer_reviews.text: So far, my baby is sleeping better with this wedge. Moves easily from crib to pack n play. Update: It helps our baby sleep so much better that we bought a second one. One for his pack n play in our room and one for his crib.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great for transitioning from rock n play
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for the best way to transition my daughter from her rock and play to her pack n play. It fits great in the pack n play which is a 7 year old graco. It gives just enough incline to keep her propped but not so much to be uncomfortable. I finally have my bed back and her safely transitioned from her rock n play with the wedge. It is not a huge incline so if you are looking for bigger incline read the details. Pictures make it seem steeper. But it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent incline
customer_reviews.text: This incline is decent. It gets the job done and for the price I would not return. My issues 1) answers to questions says it will fit in a pack and play, but it only does so if folded or the long way 2) to fold it, it need to be unzipped. Unzipped means the inside (foam) is exposed. So just higher ability to get dirty and can’t clean that part easily. Overall gets the job done so I will keep it
customer_reviews.author: kips

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping longer!
customer_reviews.text: The very first night using this wedge, our baby slept long and we are so rested! Prior to the wedge we were waking up almost every 1-2 hours due to our baby’s gas and spit ups. I highly recommend this wedge. I placed it underneath the entire mattress and placed our second one underneath the pack n play pad. We have 2 because or baby sleeps both in a standard crib in his room and in the pack n play on upper newborn level. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Spraker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome crib wedge
customer_reviews.text: My son is slowly acclimating to his crib from his swing, he’s 3 months now. And this wedge really helps him with his reflux as he’s trying to nap during the day. This one does not go under the mattress as it is soft, but rather under the bed sheets which in my opinion is honestly so much easier. It comes folded in half and unzipped but so easy to zip up then it’s ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is literally an inch high, so it doesn’t really make sense to buy if you’re wanting to have your baby sit elevated- in which case we did because our newborn has Colic. It makes absolutely no difference at all. I wish it was 4-5 inches thicker
customer_reviews.author: Katie Danzer

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed because I was hoping this would be good ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this when my daughter was 2 months old because I wouldn't hear her in the middle of the night spitting up because of her reflux. Well after using it for about a day I noticed she would just roll off of it and onto the bed where it was flat anyways. Super disappointed because I was hoping this would be good for us but I guess it's not meant for babies at this age that move a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: BEST SUPPORT WEDGE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6 years ago for my son. We used it under his crib mattress, not under his sheet. He had reflux and sinus type issues. This helped give him just a slight enough incline to make a difference. He did not roll off or over. It was and is very safe. I still use it under his twin mattress to this day to help with his sinus issues or when he has cold or respiratory issues. We let 2-year-old brother borrow it for his first cold and we clearly needed a second. I just purchased our second one and I'm completly satisfied again. They both have one and it provides breathing relief and comfort during the winter months!
customer_reviews.author: lydia

customer_reviews.title: Great price,
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can put it under my sons crib mattress and It is the same width. It elevates baby just enough. My son has reflux and slept in the Snoo with leg lifters and did great and this mimics the same degree as the leg lifters in my opinion. Baby gets a good night sleep and so do I. Well needed.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This was helpful on two fronts -- when we were shifting our baby to sleep in the crib, from the rock n play, and when the baby had a cold. Yes, he rolled down the mattress over the course of the night. But since we stopped using the wedge, he still manages to wriggle his way from one end of the crib to the other, so I won't blame the wedge for that. If he gets another cold, I won't hesitate to pop it back under his mattress. It was very easy to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to fold this for a higher incline you have to unzip the middle to do so. There is only one zipper and it is the one that holds the styrofoam inside the pillow. I also don't recommend you to lay baby directly on it, because the material is plastic, making it easy to clean, but causes your baby to sweat because it doesn't breathe at all.
customer_reviews.author: New mother

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to get positioned properly
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept, but the "no slip" technology definitely was not present. I struggled to get it properly positioned under my baby's sheet. I like the concept, though, and once you get it situated, you shouldn't have to move it until you change the sheets. It would be nice if there were adjustable straps so it could attach to the mattress and stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: MNH

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't buy this. Is thin, uncomfortable and really doesn't help prop up your baby like i thought it would. I open the package & threw away the box it came in. Otherwise would have returned it. I went by all the reviews on here. I think ppl spoke way too highly of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crib wedge
customer_reviews.text: Our pediatrician recommended buying a crib wedge. I purchased two one for the pack n play and one for the crib. My son is not quite 2 months old and when i checked on him i found that the wedge was just enough that he could maneuver himself to the bottom of the wedge and he would be laying a different direction then i placed him in the crib. I think ill wait until hes a little bit older to put the wedge back in his pack n play or crib.

customer_reviews.title: Stuffy nose baby sleeps better elevated.
customer_reviews.text: This works good for elevation during sleep for a 3 month old baby with nasal issues. I put it on top of mattress under the fitted sheet which seems to work out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R Leland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for regular crib, not for mini crib
customer_reviews.text: This is a amazing wedge! I bought this wedge for my son's mini crib due to others review. Does not work for a mini crib!!!! There's a inch on each side that hangs over and where the wedge folds in half for portability. The plastic bunches up due to being to big. For a regular crib, I highly recommend! Perfect angle that's not to steep of a incline!!
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: For a reflux baby
customer_reviews.text: My baby has reflux so I thought that this would be a good idea to prop him up so the stomach acids didn't build up in his throat. The design seems good he doesn't slide down like he did with the towel under the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: My child moved his arms and legs too much in his crib. He would wiggle his way off in just a few minutes even when swaddled. Didn't work for my squirmy infant.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great for preventing spit up or ease congestion.
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for both the pack and play and the crib. My infant daughter was frequently spitting up and this helped her keep her food down and sleep better. It stays in place and is easy to store away. When your child is older and they become congested this is a handy tool to use. Wish I would have had this with my oldest.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: For price maybe
customer_reviews.text: The strip on the bottom got wavy after a couple nights of sleeping and it’s hard/uncomfy to lay on. I have to place blanket under her which I don’t like having to do. Angle is great tho and it would be easy to wipe clean due to material used.
customer_reviews.author: Marc & Leah P

customer_reviews.title: We have tried several wedges: under the mattrass and ...
customer_reviews.text: We have tried several wedges: under the mattrass and under the sheet. And this one is the only one we actually kept and using. It fits our crib and provides elevation we were looking for. However, we gave 4 star because product can be slightly improved. The top edge of the wedge creates 2 inch gap between crib and mattress/ wedge and bottom of the wedge sticks out making it somewhat uncomfartable for baby.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for baby reflux
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My 3 month old has reflux and this wedge is just what we needed. Keeps her head elevated and prevents spit up. Would buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Audra Heath

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mattress wedge
customer_reviews.text: Product easily folded down to use in bassinet with smaller mattress as well as unfolds to use on larger mattress in crib. Have really loved this product as baby tends to spit up after falling asleep and this helps to keep her upright so the spit up milk comes out of her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This
customer_reviews.text: Agree with others. This feels and looks very cheap - both the foam and the cover. The foam has a rough, cheap feel and the cover has a stiff, cheap stiff. Definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: GraceAlone

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2 month old who was had a cough from congestion as well as excessive spit up. It arrived packaged well. I love that it folds for easy storage. While I was hoping for a soft cover, it was actually rubber but that makes for easy cleaning if that was a problem. I did notice a slight improvement in spit up frequency at night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... for a three month old baby who does not like his crib so I thought maybe his head would ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a three month old baby who does not like his crib so I thought maybe his head would like to be raised a little bit. He still does not like his crib, however. The product itself is just as explained and hopefully one day the baby will sleep in his crib.
customer_reviews.author: karen parker

customer_reviews.title: Using as a great tummy time pillow
customer_reviews.text: We are not using this as a crib wedge, but as a tummy time pillow. We place our son’s forearms on the ground and his chest on the wedge helps prop him up a bit and it more comfortable than the floor. Plus it’s water proof so drool just wipes off!
customer_reviews.author: J. Grow

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for babies with reflux
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about this product sooner. My son has reflux and will not sleep flat on his back. He would only sleep in his swing/rock n play which made me nervous. It’s been about a week since we started using the wedge and he is sleeping great in his crib now! He occasionally will end up sliding down and off the wedge but it doesn’t seem to bother him once he has had a chance to digest his food. Would definitely recommend this product to any parent who’s baby is struggling with reflux!
customer_reviews.author: ambersweet357

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not as high as id hoped but it splits into 2 pieces and can be used that way so very convenient for adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Andrade-Scott

customer_reviews.title: Baby does roll off
customer_reviews.text: Giving 4 stars because there is a gap between the mattress and crib so I ended up putting it under the mattress and it still had good incline. If your baby rolls like mine does he/she will end up rolling to the side so I put a towel under the mattress and will use this once he gets a little older.
customer_reviews.author: JMAC

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased..
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this when my baby got his first cold at 2 months. We had just transitioned him to the crib but I was worried about him coughing/spitting up and didn’t want to put him back in the rocker sleeper. I put this under his mattress and it works great! I had it under his sheets originally, but it took away the firmness of his mattress and made me worried he face would sink into it during sleep. The baby has slid down a little while sleeping but overall seems way more comfortable. I agree it’s overpriced but the piece of mind it’s given my husband and I is totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over all we like it but...
customer_reviews.text: This is easy ans seems safe, and I believe it helps with my babys acid reflux WHEN she stays on it. Shes only 2 months, so hopefully when she gets bigger she will stay elevated on this pillow, but many times I awake to find she has rolled off the pillow completely and is laying sideways in her crib as a result
customer_reviews.author: Lysa

customer_reviews.title: Much better than trying to use a pillow under the crib mattress.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby was used to sleeping elevated in his rock n play, so when he outgrew it we tried to make his transition to the crib as similar as possible. We tried using a spare pillow under the mattress, but the angle just wasn’t right. I highly recommend a crib wedge, and this one works great! I love the convenience of it. It folds so it would be easy for traveling. It’s also easy to clean. This and the dockatot really saved us on the crib transition!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy that it can be folded in half to thicken it. I used that feature a few times. It seemed to help my son when he was having a little reflux. This helped me sleep better at night knowing he had a little angle to give him more time to digest after night feedings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom approved...could use some slight tweaking
customer_reviews.text: These wedges have come in super handy. I bought two--one for my daughter's crib and one for underneath her changing pad due to her reflux. They work perfectly for underneath the crib mattress. I noticed they do have a non-slip strip running down the middle, however, I still have a problem with the wedge sliding out from underneath the changing pad. Perhaps the area of the non-slip strip could be increased! Other than that, they work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby who doesnt like sleeping on her back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old who was not transitioning well from her Rock N Play to a crib. This wedge is a hit and she's sleeping through the night!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Sox

customer_reviews.title: Exactly size needed ordered a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: Updated: May 2019, I just ordered a 2nd wedge for when we travel. I always forget to pack it so now I will always have one for her. The wedge was prefect. My 2 month old daughter got RSV, bronchitis and a cold and she needed to be elevated. For the price this cant be beat. It was so easy to use. Just opened it up and place under sheet.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, especially for a special needs kid
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has 6 congenital heart defects and has been struggling with congestion at all times of the day. Placing this wedge under her crib sheet and placing her on it correctly has made a huge difference in her ability to sleep better at night. I’m so convinced it works that I just bought another one to give as a gift to a friend who just had her little one.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Whites

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We’ve noticed a decrease in the amount of spitting up our baby does at night after purchasing this pillow. She is also sleeping longer during the night. She spent a few days in the NICU at birth and we noticed that she slept well when her head was slightly elevated. This does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Only small Is the non slip grip doesn’t work well on plastic covered mattresses but so far the sheet holds it in place so we will see. But it shipped fast and installed easily and it’s smooth transition between edge of wedge and mattress which prevents sliding. Glad it’s such a safe product for my little one. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Asia Nalls

customer_reviews.title: good product, make sure it is the correct size
customer_reviews.text: The wedge seemed like it would be great if it fits precisely under the mattress. Our family has the guava lotus portable bassinet/crib and the wedge was just too large for it. It might work better in an actual portable crib. But it seems like a great product.
customer_reviews.author: CStewart

customer_reviews.title: Efficient buy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean seems to Resemble the same make up of the changing table pad. Folds for easy transportation and has a zipper cover. Has been wonderful for our daughter with reflux. Only problem and she slides down her mattress
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cover full crib
customer_reviews.text: You can just put it in the middle of the crib, so the issue is when baby moves or tries to turn it will be short and baby head may fall. This should cover entire crib.
customer_reviews.author: Niks

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping baby
customer_reviews.text: We are in love. Our baby girl didn't sleep in her crib until now. We've had a very fussy newborn at night because of reflux. We received it today and so far she's been asleep for an hour and thirst minutes. No coughing, gagging and most importantly no spit up or signs of discomfort. We are grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: The idea and concept is great. However
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my baby had reflux and wanted this to help keep her elevated and prevent spit up. The idea and concept is great. However, once she started to roll around it was basically no longer effective. She never stayed on the pillow and would roll all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Fits securely
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to unpack and zip together and takes seconds to place it on the crib mattress and replace the crib sheet. There's no extra space between the sides of the wedge and the crib, which is a big relief. The slope is perfect, my son is slightly elevated and sleeps like a champ now w/out sliding down off it.
customer_reviews.author: Axdann

customer_reviews.title: Five star product
customer_reviews.text: I like the design it can switch between 15 degree and 30 degree.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Crib wedge
customer_reviews.text: The wedge wasn’t as high as i had originally anticipated, however it worked well and gave me piece of mind when laying my baby down to sleep after a feeding. Will keep around for when she catches a cold and needs to be elevated to help breathing.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Sipes

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place
customer_reviews.text: This product is everything we could have hoped for and more! I like that it stays in place; we had a similar product with our older child and it was always sliding around in the bed. Not this one though, it stays securely in place under the sheet. It works great at helping to reduce acid reflux in our six-month-old. It was incredibly easy to install and will be easy to clean when/if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Leis

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to everyone
customer_reviews.text: Love this purchase. I recommend it to all of my mom to be friends. I used it when my baby was still in the spit up stage, when she had a cold/runny nose or is teething. Works great. Just the right amount of elevation.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T.

customer_reviews.title: Too low profile for my baby
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning the prduct as it is too low. It barely creates an elevation. I purchased the item due to my baby's nasal congestion and reflux. There are other products a little higher than this product so I'm going for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Try
customer_reviews.text: My little one was having trouble sleeping so I thought a crib wedge would help. It fit perfectly under the pack n play mattress. This is a great price and good quality. However, he kept slipping down like he was on a slide. If I still had the box I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: I like it for my baby.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a tiny bit thicker but my baby still uses it and she’s 14 months. It’s great to have this especially when you don’t want your baby to lay flat on their back. This was a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for reflux
customer_reviews.text: This wedge was perfect for when our baby had reflux. It's the width of the crib and has non slip strips on the bottom. Cover is made out of a plasticky material, so easy to clean. Has a zipper so you could remove foam if needed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Argast

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for reflux
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product so I could transition my newborn from the rock n play to the crib. Her acid reflux has been an issue though so thankfully this has helped. I also bought the Reste Safe Swaddle to make sure my baby didn’t slide down the incline.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri S

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My baby has acid reflux and can't sleep flat on her back. We had her in a rock n play for 4 months, but she needed more space. I purchased this wedge and she slept in her crib with no problems!! It is the exact width of the crib, doesn't move, and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Marilee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect incline
customer_reviews.text: Slight incline when unzipped and a higher incline when zipped together. Seems to help my daughter at night when she has a cold.
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely blown away by such great excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely blown away by such great excellent service! My first pillow that I ordered was shipped to me with a small defect and within the hour of letting hiccapop they immediately responded to my concern! Our daughter was having a hard time with spit up in the middle of the night, she would occasionally joke and it would scare us. Since we have been using the pilllow she’s been sleeping much more peacefully in the night! This pillow wondeful! I’m so pleased with the pillow and how well my daughter has been sleeping so much better! Thank you for your great product hiccapop!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well in the baby cribs. I put it under the baby mattress and it worked great. I bought a Graco mattress that was memory foam and it has never formed properly. So now I use the wedge to level out that stupid mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Irina C.

customer_reviews.title: Hard piece on fold
customer_reviews.text: Great angle but there is a hard piece in the middle of the wedge where the wedge was folded for shipping. Even if you turn it over it’s still there.
customer_reviews.author: Nurseldy

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Our baby has reflux and though she ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Our baby has reflux and though she still spits up (a lot sometimes) when we put her in her crib with the wedge, the spit up doesn't pool around her head, and has made sleeping easier and more comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver for baby with bad reflux! Just put it under the sheet- it stayed in place beautifully. Even when we got past the issue I would use it when he had congestion- while still too young for pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Govro

customer_reviews.title: Light spongy texure, Nice under baby sheet
customer_reviews.text: This pillow goes nice under baby's sheet. Low enough for their little necks. I bought this for my infant grandson and he's now 19 Mo's. I still keep it under sheet but sometimes but sometimes I use a pillow instead is he gets congested. Its like a light spongy material.
customer_reviews.author: Marie J.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to help my baby with reflux sleep better. So easy to install and works as advertised with no sliding around and no gaps! A little tight of a fit for the pack n play but it deserves not cause any safety or comfort issues.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Good for GERD baby
customer_reviews.text: Our new baby has GERD, and besides medicine, this was one of the most helpful things we found for it. She slept better (4/4.5 hours instead of 2.5) and had less reflux episodes during the night. The only issue is the sliding down, which we adjusted whenever we checked on her anyways.
customer_reviews.author: EKBVS

customer_reviews.title: Fits in co-sleeper perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We actually purchased this item because our 5 month old loves to sleep on her side, but gets frustrated when he flips back on to her back. So we put this product on the side under the mattress of her co-sleeper. It fit perfectly and she seems to love it. No more waking up .. or us up.. because she's flipped on her back!
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok. My baby has bad acid reflux so I needed to get him a crib wedge since the bassinet wedge worked amazingly. I haven’t put him in the crib yet so we will see how it works. :)
customer_reviews.author: Marissa13

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Not for my baby. The top material was of very cheap quality. It was like my baby head was on plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kunal

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: My baby has reflux and we got this for him hoping it would help at night. So far it's helping with spitting up we think (he's also taking medication though....) and gives us a little peace of mind knowing he's slightly inclined
customer_reviews.author: Sheryle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my daughter liked to sleep proped up (not flat) and I slipped it under her fitted sheet and it fit amazingly good. It helped her sleep and after she out grew it it was very easy to fold up and put away
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Louise Ripp

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed in this product. In the middle where the zipper begins, once you zip it closed, it sticks out and feels like it's poking baby. I tried taping it down but you can still feel it and I worry that baby will sleep on it and feel it on his head or elsewhere on his body when he lays in the middle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Our baby doesnt yet sleep through the night with this product, but for afternoon naps it works great. He has pretty bad reflux, and hates to be aid down flat. This product helps reduce how flat he lays and he seems to feel more at ease. Will update once he sleeps through the night in his crib :)
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cox

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't elevate mattress enough
customer_reviews.text: At first I had this wedge under her sheet but I would get up in the middle of the night and she'd be down the other end of the crib sideways. I now have it under the mattress but it doesn't elevate it enough. Her reflux is still awful. I dont recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: We returned it. Seemed very unsafe. Our 2 month old would slide down in the middle of the night and be close to rolling over.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fits the crib. Helps with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and fits the crib. Helps with my babies reflux bc she has to be elevated when lying on her back. This solves the issue and is still safe. I thought it would be a thicker/taller wedge but it works
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Stiner

customer_reviews.title: Helped us so much
customer_reviews.text: Put this under my son mattress, he had bad stomach issues and the lift this gave him helped so so much so worth it when you have a crying newborn in pain! Loved this saved our life
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Nice wedge
customer_reviews.text: The wedge is nice and easy to install. The only thing that needs improving is the grips on the bottom of it. I have a plastic waterproof mattress and it slides around.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler

product_meta.title: hiccapop Crib Wedge for Babies with Deluxe Soft Plush Water-Resistant Cover | Baby Wedge for Cribs with Soft Fabric Cover | Roll and Go for Travel
product_meta.description:
Color:[New] Soft Plush Cover

OVER 4,000,000 UNITS SOLD. 
For 20 years, the 12 degree incline of the hiccapop Safe Lift sleep wedge has been used to optimally incline your baby and toddler’s head and torso during periods of discomfort associated with a range of uncomfortable ailments. By elevating your child’s body, your baby sleeps more soundly.

CONSUMER PRODUCT SAFETY COMMISSION APPROVED SIZE - Rest easy knowing your child is safe.
The CPSC has strict guidelines to ensure the safety of your child in their crib or toddler bed. They have deemed 27.25” in width to be the safest dimension and this wedge has been tested and approved. Beware of other wedges that cut corners by producing narrower wedges.

Hate wrestling with crib sheets?
The NEW, SOFT FABRIC COVER keeps this baby wedge in one place so that you don’t have to continually remove the sheets to readjust.

MACHINE WASHABLE COVER
Simply toss the removable cover into the washing machine for hassle-free sanitization.

WIGGLY BABIES MAY SLIDE DOWN WEDGE
It's inevitable that many babies will wiggle and move and may slide down the wedge. This is normal and unavoidable without dangerously adding blankets or other props to either side of your baby. This is strictly advised against.

LIFETIME GUARANTEE - After 20 years of selling our universal crib wedge, we happily stand behind our product. 

CertiPUR-US® Certification
CertiPUR-US® foam is made without PBDEs, TDCPP or TCEP ("Tris") flame retardants, mercury, lead, heavy metals, formaldehyde, phthalates regulated by the CPSC, and CFCs.
feature_bullets: ELEVATE BABY'S HEAD & TORSO - Our perfect 12 degree incline props up your child's head and body. This raised orientation adds comfort which leads to better sleep

27.25" WEDGE PASSES ALL FEDERAL SAFETY REGULATIONS - Only crib wedge that has been reviewed and tested for sale by the CPSC. BEWARE OF WEDGES THAT DO NOT PROVIDE REQUIRED TESTING UPON REQUEST. Perfect for all cribs and toddler beds.

MACHINE-WASHABLE, WATER-RESISTANT, STAIN RESISTANT COVER - Our removable soft cover makes for easy cleanup of baby spit-up, drooling, and diaper leaks. Simply toss it in the washing machine for hassle-free sanitization.

SAFELY & RESPONSIBLY MANUFACTURED | CertiPUR-US FOAM is made without PBDEs, TDCPP or TCEP ("Tris") flame retardants, mercury, lead, heavy metals, formaldehyde, phthalates regulated by the CPSC, and CFCs. It is performance-tested, durability-tested & emissions-tested by independent accredited testing labs. Trust the best. WATERPROOF cover with NON-SKID BOTTOM holds wedge firmly in place for safety and convenience. OVER 4,000,000 UNITS SOLD.

ROLL AND GO TRAVEL FRIENDLY - Heading out of town? Simply roll the wedge, place it in the carry bag and pack it snuggly in the trunk or suitcase. Our attractive packaging makes it a great gift for new parents, too.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars301 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
